ramayana.title: రామాయణం
ramayana.description: The Ramayana is an ancient Indian epic that teaches dharma, truth, devotion, and righteousness through the life of Lord Rama.

main_characters.name: Rama
main_characters.role: Prince of Ayodhya, avatar of Vishnu, embodiment of dharma.

main_characters.name: Sita
main_characters.role: Wife of Rama, symbol of purity and devotion.

main_characters.name: Hanuman
main_characters.role: Devotee of Rama, symbol of strength and devotion.

main_characters.name: Ravana
main_characters.role: King of Lanka, symbol of ego and adharma.

important_places.name: Mithila
important_places.desc: King Janaka’s kingdom, birthplace of Sita.

timeline.desc: Rama is born to King Dasharatha in Ayodhya.
Rama goes to forest for 14 years.
Rama defeats Ravana and rescues Sita.
Rama rules Ayodhya with justice and peace.

bala_kanda.description: The Bala Kanda describes the birth, childhood, education, and marriage of Lord Rama.

sargas.title: Narada Describes Rama
sargas.story: Sage Valmiki asks Narada who the greatest man is. Narada tells him about Rama, a perfect man who follows dharma.
sargas.lesson: A good person always follows dharma.

sargas.title: Birth of Rama
sargas.story: King Dasharatha performs a sacrifice. With divine blessings, Rama and his brothers are born.

sargas.title: Rama’s Childhood
sargas.story: Rama grows up as a kind, brave, and obedient prince loved by all.
sargas.lesson: Good behavior earns love and respect.

sargas.title: Training under Sage Vishwamitra
sargas.story: Rama and Lakshmana go with Sage Vishwamitra to protect sacrifices from demons.
sargas.lesson: Protecting good people is our duty.

sargas.title: Killing of Demons
sargas.story: Rama defeats demons like Tataka and Subahu using divine weapons.

sargas.title: Journey to Mithila
sargas.story: Rama travels to Mithila to attend Sita’s swayamvara.

sargas.title: Breaking Shiva’s Bow
sargas.story: Rama lifts and breaks Lord Shiva’s bow, winning Sita’s hand.

sargas.title: Marriage of Rama and Sita
sargas.story: Rama and Sita are married in a grand ceremony.
sargas.lesson: Marriage is a bond of love and duty.

sargas.title: Return to Ayodhya
sargas.story: Rama returns to Ayodhya with Sita and his brothers.

ayodhya_kanda.description: Ayodhya Kanda tells the story of Rama’s exile, Bharata’s devotion, and the pain and sacrifice of the royal family.

sargas.title: Rama Chosen as King
sargas.story: King Dasharatha decides to crown Rama as king. The people of Ayodhya rejoice.
sargas.lesson: Good leaders are loved by all.

sargas.title: Kaikeyi’s Boons
sargas.story: Queen Kaikeyi reminds Dasharatha of two boons. She asks Bharata to be king and Rama to go to the forest for fourteen years.
sargas.lesson: Wrong desires can cause great pain.

sargas.title: Rama Accepts Exile
sargas.story: Rama calmly accepts exile to keep his father’s promise. Sita and Lakshmana decide to go with him.
sargas.lesson: Keeping one’s word is true dharma.

sargas.title: Dasharatha’s Sorrow
sargas.story: Dasharatha is heartbroken and soon passes away, remembering Rama.

sargas.title: Bharata Returns
sargas.story: Bharata returns from his uncle’s kingdom and is shocked to learn what happened.

sargas.title: Bharata Meets Rama
sargas.story: Bharata goes to the forest and begs Rama to return and rule. Rama refuses politely.
sargas.lesson: Duty is greater than personal comfort.

sargas.title: Padukas Rule Ayodhya
sargas.story: Bharata places Rama’s sandals on the throne and rules as a servant of Rama.

aranya_kanda.description: Aranya Kanda describes Rama’s life in the forest, the conflict with demons, and the abduction of Sita by Ravana.

sargas.title: Life in the Forest
sargas.story: Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana live peacefully in the forest, visiting sages and protecting them from danger.
sargas.lesson: Peace comes from a simple life.

sargas.title: Surpanakha Appears
sargas.story: The demoness Surpanakha tries to marry Rama. When rejected, she attacks Sita and is stopped by Lakshmana.

sargas.title: Golden Deer
sargas.story: Maricha appears as a golden deer. Rama follows it, leaving Sita alone.
sargas.lesson: Illusion can distract even the wise.

sargas.title: Abduction of Sita
sargas.story: Ravana kidnaps Sita and takes her to Lanka.

sargas.title: Jatayu’s Sacrifice
sargas.story: The bird Jatayu fights Ravana to save Sita and sacrifices his life.

kishkindha_kanda.description: Kishkindha Kanda tells how Rama meets Hanuman, helps Sugriva regain his kingdom, and begins the search for Sita.

sargas.title: Meeting Hanuman
sargas.story: Hanuman meets Rama and Lakshmana and recognizes Rama as divine. A deep friendship begins.

sargas.title: Alliance with Sugriva
sargas.story: Rama promises to help Sugriva defeat his brother Vali and regain the throne.

sargas.title: Defeat of Vali
sargas.story: Rama defeats Vali, freeing Sugriva from fear and injustice.

sargas.title: Sugriva Crowned King
sargas.story: Sugriva becomes king of Kishkindha and promises to help find Sita.

sargas.title: Search for Sita Begins
sargas.story: Vanara armies are sent in all directions to search for Sita.

sundara_kanda.description: Sundara Kanda focuses on Hanuman’s heroic journey to Lanka, his meeting with Sita, and his fearless devotion to Rama.

sargas.title: Hanuman Leaps Across the Ocean
sargas.story: Hanuman remembers his powers and leaps across the ocean to reach Lanka.

sargas.title: Entering Lanka
sargas.story: Hanuman secretly enters Lanka and observes its strength and beauty.

sargas.title: Finding Sita in Ashoka Vatika
sargas.story: Hanuman finds Sita in Ashoka Vatika, sad but faithful to Rama.

sargas.title: Rama’s Ring
sargas.story: Hanuman gives Rama’s ring to Sita, giving her hope.

sargas.title: Burning of Lanka
sargas.story: Hanuman burns parts of Lanka to show Rama’s power.

yuddha_kanda.description: Yuddha Kanda describes the great war between Rama and Ravana, ending with the victory of dharma.

sargas.title: Building the Bridge to Lanka
sargas.story: Rama builds a bridge across the ocean with the help of the vanara army to reach Lanka.

sargas.title: Beginning of the War
sargas.story: A fierce war begins between Rama’s army and Ravana’s forces.

sargas.title: Kumbhakarna’s Fall
sargas.story: Kumbhakarna fights bravely but is defeated by Rama.

sargas.title: Death of Ravana
sargas.story: Rama defeats Ravana after a long battle, restoring peace and justice.

sargas.title: Rescue of Sita
sargas.story: Sita is rescued and reunited with Rama.

uttara_kanda.description: Uttara Kanda describes Rama’s return to Ayodhya, his righteous rule, Sita’s final trial, and the lasting legacy of Rama.

sargas.title: Return to Ayodhya
sargas.story: Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana return to Ayodhya. The people celebrate with joy. Rama is crowned king.
sargas.lesson: Good deeds are rewarded in time.

sargas.title: Rama Rajya
sargas.story: Rama rules the kingdom with justice, kindness, and fairness. People live happily and safely.
sargas.lesson: A good ruler cares for everyone.

sargas.title: Sita’s Trial
sargas.story: To clear doubts, Sita proves her purity and later chooses to return to the Earth.

sargas.title: Rama’s Legacy
sargas.story: Rama continues to guide the world as an ideal of dharma, even after his earthly life.
